πρόσκομμα, ατος, τό,
(προσκόπτω) stumble, λίθου πρόσκομμα [LXX]; ὁ λίθος τοῦ π. [NT]: hence, offence, obstacle, hindrance, [LXX+NT]
__II result of stumbling, bruise, hurt, προσκομμάτων ἀπόλυσις [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: stumbling block, something that causes one to stumble
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
stumbling block, something that causes one to stumble
a stumbling, Rom. 9:32, 33; 1Pet. 2:8; metaphorically a stumbling block, an occasion of sinning, means of inducing to sin, Rom. 14:13; 1Cor. 8:9; metaphorically a moral stumbling, a shock to the moral or religious sense, a moral embarrassment, Rom. 14:20*
